text.__SUMMARY__: Syrnola producta is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The length of the shell varies between 4 mm and 6.4 mm. The teleoconch of the smooth shell contains eight flatly convex whorls. The color of the shell is white, under a light brown epidermis. The columella is flexuously plicate.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
Northwest Atlantic off Massachusetts, Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey
text.Notes:
Additional information regarding this species:
Distribution: Range: 42°N to 40°N; 74°W to 70°W. Distribution: USA: Massachusetts, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey
